brief.content-text:
Link to Lab Summary: Putting It All Together

Use the knowledge and skills presented in this course to perform the following tasks:
Analyze a network design and create a hierarchical addressing scheme.
Configure switches with multiple V LAN's, VTP, and port security.
Configure routers and switches to allow inter-V LAN routing.
Configure multiple routers using OSPF, PAT, a default route, and route summarization.
Configure WAN links using PPP and authentication.
Configure ACL's to control network access and to secure routers.
Verify connectivity, device configuration, and functionality.
